description: Presidio Federal HAI Network Validation Test Catalog - Multi-Framework, Multi-Vendor Compliance Testing

metadata.purpose: Centralized compliance testing repository for network infrastructure

STIG.description: Department of Defense security configuration standards
STIG.note: Tests are organized by data extraction method (nso, native, api) then by vendor/platform

nso.description: Tests that consume NSO data models (tailf-ncs:config structure)

data_validation.description: Configuration validation using pytest against NSO data models

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000040.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must generate traffic log entries containing information to establish what type of events occurred.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000050.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must generate traffic log entries containing information to establish when (date and time) the events occurred.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000090.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must queue log records locally in the event that the central audit server is down or not reachable.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000100.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must use TCP when sending log records to the central audit server.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000130.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must disable or remove unnecessary network services and functions that are not used as part of its role in the architecture.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000150.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must enable threat detection to mitigate risks of denial-of-service (DoS) attacks.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000200.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must send log data of denied traffic to a central audit server for analysis.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000210.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must generate a real-time alert to organization-defined personnel if communication with the central audit server is lost.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000220.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must implement scanning threat detection.

tests.name: nso-CASA-FW-000270.py
tests.description: The Cisco ASA must inspect all inbound and outbound traffic at the application layer.

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and security policy validation

router.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Router NDM STIG (NSO)

data_validation.description: Configuration validation using pytest against NSO data models

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-001210.py
tests.description: Ensure SSH version 2 and secure password configurations on router platforms.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000100.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to automatically audit account modification.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000010.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to limit the number of concurrent management sessions to an organization-defined number.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000620.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must only store cryptographic representations of passwords (password encryption service).

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000720.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to terminate all network connections associated with device management after five minutes of inactivity.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000150.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must enforce the limit of three consecutive invalid logon attempts, after which time it must lock out the user account for 15 minutes.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000280.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must produce audit records containing information to establish when (date and time) the events occurred.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-000380.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to protect audit information from unauthorized modification by restricting file system access to privilege level 15.

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and security policy validation

switch.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Switch NDM STIG (NSO)

data_validation.description: Configuration validation using pytest against NSO data models

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-001210.py
tests.description: Ensure SSH version 2 and FIPS-approved encryption algorithms are configured instead of insecure protocols like Telnet or HTTP.

tests.name: nso-CISC-ND-001200.py
tests.description: The Cisco switch must be configured to use FIPS-validated Keyed-Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to protect the integrity of remote maintenance sessions.

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and security policy validation

native.description: Tests that consume raw device configurations (show running-config output)
native.data_format: Raw CLI text or parsed structured data (TextFSM, Genie, TTP)

router.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Router NDM STIG (Native)

data_validation.description: Configuration validation using pytest against native CLI/API JSON

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000100.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to automatically audit account modification.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000010.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to limit the number of concurrent management sessions to an organization-defined number.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000620.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must only store cryptographic representations of passwords (password encryption service).

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000720.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to terminate all network connections associated with device management after five minutes of inactivity.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-001210.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to use SSH version 2 and FIPS-approved encryption algorithms.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000150.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must enforce the limit of three consecutive invalid logon attempts, after which time it must lock out the user account for 15 minutes.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000280.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must produce audit records containing information to establish when (date and time) the events occurred.

tests.name: native-CISC-ND-000380.py
tests.description: The Cisco router must be configured to protect audit information from unauthorized modification by restricting file system access to privilege level 15.

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and security policy validation

switch.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Switch RTR STIG (Native & State)

data_validation.description: Configuration validation using pytest against native CLI/API JSON

tests.name: native-CISC-RT-000150.py
tests.description: The Cisco switch must be configured to have Gratuitous ARP disabled on all external interfaces to protect against ARP spoofing and DoS attacks.

tests.name: native-CISC-RT-000230.py
tests.description: The Cisco switch must be configured to disable the auxiliary port unless it is connected to a secured modem providing encryption and authentication to prevent war dialing attacks and unauthorized dial-in access.

tests.name: state-CISC-RT-000060.py
tests.description: The Cisco switch must have all inactive interfaces disabled. This test uses pyATS to identify interfaces that are administratively up but operationally down or have minimal traffic, which should be reviewed and shutdown.

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and security policy validation

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000001.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must limit the number of concurrent sessions to a maximum of 10 or less for remote access using SSH.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000087.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must be configured to limit the number of configuration rollbacks that are stored.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000106.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must be configured to send critical and emergency log messages to user terminals.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000114.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must ensure TCP forwarding is disabled for SSH to prevent unauthorized access and SSH tunneling that could bypass firewall controls.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000124.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms by configuring SSH with approved HMAC algorithms to prevent replay attacks.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000136.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must use SHA-256 or later protocol for password authentication for local accounts to protect passwords from compromise.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000150.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote maintenance sessions using FIPS 140-2 approved algorithms.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000133.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must enforce password complexity by requiring at least one special character for local accounts.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000132.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must enforce password complexity by requiring at least one numeric character for local accounts.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000131.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must enforce password complexity by requiring at least one lowercase character for local accounts.

tests.name: native-JUSX-DM-000130.py
tests.description: The Juniper SRX Services Gateway must enforce password complexity by requiring at least one uppercase character for local accounts.

api.description: Tests that consume vendor-specific API data (DNAC, SD-WAN vManage, etc.)

NIST-800-53.description: Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations

PCI-DSS.full_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
PCI-DSS.description: Security standards for organizations that handle credit card data

nso.description: Tests that consume NSO data models

router.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Router PCI-DSS Compliance (NSO)

tests.name: nso_pci_8_3_6_account_lockout.py
tests.description: Account lockout duration must be at least 30 minutes after failed authentication attempts per PCI-DSS 8.3.6.

tests.name: nso_pci_10_3_4_log_timestamps.py
tests.description: Date and time must be included in all audit log entries per PCI-DSS 10.3.4.

tests.name: nso_pci_2_2_2_password_encryption.py
tests.description: Vendor default accounts and passwords must be managed; all passwords must be encrypted per PCI-DSS 2.2.2.

native.description: Tests that consume native CLI/API configurations
native.data_format: Raw CLI text or parsed JSON

router.full_name: Cisco IOS XE Router PCI-DSS Compliance (Native)

tests.name: native_pci_8_3_6_account_lockout.py
tests.description: Account lockout duration must be at least 30 minutes after failed authentication attempts per PCI-DSS 8.3.6.

tests.name: native_pci_10_3_4_log_timestamps.py
tests.description: Date and time must be included in all audit log entries per PCI-DSS 10.3.4.

tests.name: native_pci_2_2_2_password_encryption.py
tests.description: Vendor default accounts and passwords must be managed; all passwords must be encrypted per PCI-DSS 2.2.2.

HIPAA.full_name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
HIPAA.description: Security and privacy requirements for healthcare data

Purdue.full_name: Purdue Model for Industrial Control Systems
Purdue.description: Network segmentation model for industrial control systems (ICS/OT) with zone-based security controls
Purdue.note: Purdue controls are organized by network zones/levels rather than device platforms. Each level has a YAML catalog with detailed controls.

level-3.5.description: Buffer between enterprise IT (Level 4) and site operations/OT (Level 3). Primary security objectives: boundary protection, controlled data flow, monitoring, and remote access management.

data_validation.description: Configuration validation for DMZ boundary devices

tests.name: L3.5-SC7-001_test.py
tests.description: SC-7(3) Boundary Protection / Network Segmentation - Ensure DMZ firewalls separate IT and OT networks with deny-by-default rules.

state_checks.description: Operational state validation for DMZ zone devices

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow and zone boundary validation

level-4.description: Enterprise and business network above the industrial DMZ. Hosts corporate applications, authentication services, SOC tooling, and external connectivity.

data_validation.description: Configuration validation for enterprise IT systems

state_checks.description: Operational state validation for enterprise systems

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow validation for enterprise boundary

general.description: Generic validation tests applicable across all platforms and frameworks (e.g., NTP, DNS, syslog, management access)

tests.name: test_ntp_servers.py
tests.description: Verify that devices have at least two reachable NTP servers configured and synchronized.

tests.name: test_no_cleartext_passwords.py
tests.description: Validate that no cleartext passwords are present in device configurations. Checks for unencrypted line passwords, enable passwords, username passwords, SNMP community strings, and routing protocol authentication.

state_checks.description: Generic operational state validation using pyATS/Genie

tests.name: state_bgp_neighbors.py
tests.description: Validate BGP neighbor relationships and operational state. Connects to device, learns BGP neighbors, and validates they are in established state.

tests.name: state_ospf_neighbors.py
tests.description: Validate OSPF neighbor relationships and operational state. Connects to device, learns OSPF neighbors, and validates they are in FULL state.

tests.name: state_connectivity_ping.py
tests.description: Validate network connectivity by pinging a target IP from the device. Verifies 100% packet success rate.

tests.name: state_gateway_reachability.py
tests.description: Automatically learns default gateway from routing table and verifies reachability via ping. No configuration required.

tests.name: state_logging.py
tests.description: Automatically learns configured logging destinations (syslog servers) and verifies they are reachable. Tests both logging enablement and server connectivity.

tests.name: state_dhcp_server_validation.py
tests.description: Comprehensive DHCP server validation. Runs all server checks: pool configuration, active bindings, server statistics, and pool utilization. Use this for devices acting as DHCP servers.

tests.name: state_dhcp_client_validation.py
tests.description: Comprehensive DHCP client validation. Runs all client checks: IP assignment verification and lease health monitoring. Use this for devices obtaining IP via DHCP.

tests.name: state_dhcp_relay_validation.py
tests.description: DHCP relay validation. Checks ip helper-address configuration on interfaces for multi-VLAN DHCP forwarding. Use this for devices forwarding DHCP requests to remote servers.

data_validation.description: Configuration compliance validation using pytest and JSON schema validation

state_checks.description: Operational state validation using pyATS/Genie parsers and operational commands

traffic_tests.description: Traffic flow analysis and security policy validation using Batfish or similar tools

query_examples.by_severity: Select all tests where severity='high' or severity='critical'
query_examples.combined_basic: Select all tests where framework='STIG' AND extraction_method='nso' AND vendor='cisco' AND platform='ios-xe'
query_examples.combined_specific: Select all tests where framework='STIG' AND extraction_method='nso' AND vendor='cisco' AND platform='ios-xe' AND device_type='router' AND severity='high'
query_examples.ai_agent_workflow: 1. Agent extracts data from NSO → 2. Identifies vendor=cisco, platform=ios-xe, device_type=router → 3. Query: framework='STIG' AND extraction_method='nso' AND vendor='cisco' AND platform='ios-xe' AND device_type='router'
